person.content:
Please identify the "Person" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Person". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Australia , who hold a 2-0 lead in the five-match test series , overhauled West Indies ' total of 172 all out with eight balls to spare to end a run of six successive one-day defeats .

Let's think step by step.

| Person     |
|------------|
| Australia  |
| West Indies |

Explanation:

* "Australia" is mentioned as a team that holds a lead in a test series, so it is considered a Person entity.
* "West Indies" is also mentioned as a team, so it is also considered a Person entity.
* Note that in this context, "Australia" and "West Indies" refer to the national cricket teams of these countries, and not the countries themselves.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Person" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Person".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Person     |
|------------|
| Australia  |
| West Indies |

Explanation:

* "Australia" and "West Indies" are the only entities mentioned in the paragraph that clearly refer to Persons (in this context, national cricket teams).
* "Australia" and "West Indies" are both mentioned as teams that are participating in a test series, so they are considered Person entities.
* Other entities such as "five-match test series", "172 all out", "eight balls to spare", and "one-day defeats" do not clearly refer to Persons and are not included in the table.
